subject: Data
title: Library Catalogs: The First Search Engines
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Library Catalogs: The First Search Engines.

hook.text: The Library of Alexandria had 400,000 scrolls. Without a catalog, finding anything would take a lifetime.

buildup.text: Callimachus created the Pinakes â€” a 120-scroll catalog organizing the library by author and subject.

discovery.text: Library catalogs are databases: they store metadata about objects and provide indexes for fast retrieval.

twist.text: The Dewey Decimal System (1876) was revolutionary not because it was perfect, but because it standardized search.

climax.text: Every modern database index descends from the same idea: organize data so you can find things fast.

punchline.text: Librarians invented database indexing 2,300 years ago.

quiz.question: What was the Pinakes?
options: A catalog organizing the Library of Alexandria by author and subject
